article_text:
The Detroit bankruptcy is offering a hard education in the risks of lending to deadbeat governments, which are increasing as state and local pension obligations swell. Investors who have enabled these unsustainable promises may be in for a lot more pain.

Public pension funds have posted double-digit gains four of the last five years, and asset levels have never been higher. Yet government pension costs are soaring as the bills that politicians postponed during the hard economic times come due. No less than Warren Buffett...

twitter.description: The Wall Street Journal writes that creditors, beware. Politicians are going after you, not unions.
twitter.title: Public Pension Red Alert

image.alt: Public Pension Red Alert: Creditors, beware. Politicians are going after you, not unions.

Yet government pension costs are soaring as the bills that politicians postponed during the hard economic times come due.
